The Public Service Commission of Wisconsin (PSC) is an independent regulatory agency responsible for the regulation of 1,179 Wisconsin public utilities, including those that are municipally owned.





Utility Annual Report Online Request System : The PSC can e-mail PDF copies of any available annual report publicly available in its database.
Interested parties are invited to submit comments regarding the draft interconnection agreement filed by TDS Metrocom, Inc., and Ameritech Wisconsin . Initial comments due by noon on 6/1/01 (5/31/01 if submitting by fax). Electronic versions of this draft agreement are available. (May 18, 2001)
Electronic versions of Voluntary Interconnection Agreements (available in both Word and PDF formats) are currently posted on our ftp server. Also available is an updated status report on these agreements. (May 16, 2001)
News Release: PSC Orders New Service Guarantees for Ameritech Customers. (May 14, 2001)
The PSC's Electric Reliability page has been reactivated, giving you the current state of electric reliability in Wisconsin for Summer 2001.
New: Electric Transmission Line and Power Plant Maps
Now Available: The Draft EIS for Fox Energy Generation Project . The comment period for this draft EIS ends May 29, 2001.
Access to the PSC's Databases : Database applications showing data from the PSC's databases based on criteria you choose!
Commission issues Notice of Proceeding ( Docket 6630-DR-104) requesting comments in the Matter of Wisconsin Electric Power Company’s Request for Declaratory Ruling Approving a Proposed Plan to Increase Generation in Wisconsin.
Now Available: The Final EIS for the Wisconsin Gas Company/ Guardian Pipeline Project has been issued and Phase 2 Hearings have been scheduled.
Now Available: The 2000 Annual Consumer Contact Report, 2000 Second Half Consumer Contact Report, and 2000 Annual Report on Contacts Regarding Major Utilities .
News Release: Commission Meetings to be Available Live on the Internet. (January 3, 2001)
